_gempaign/Character-Template.title: Character Template
_gempaign/Character-Template.content:
Character Template
Refer to pg. 55 of the core rules book.
Character Summary (Name, Background, Age, etc.)
Lorem ipsum dolor est.
Ancestry
Human. Gain any Novice Edge of your choice.
Hindrances
Gain +1/+2 points for each minor/major hindrance to spend elsewhere up to a max of +4. Spend 2 points to raise an attribute die type or choose an edge. Spend 1 point to gain a skill point.
Example:

Hindrance 1 (minor)
Hindrance 2 (minor)
Hindrance 3 (major)

Attributes
5 points to increase die type.

Agility: d4 (+0)
Smarts: d4 (+0)
Spirit: d4 (+0)
Strength: d4 (+0)
Vigor: d4 (+0)

Skills
15 points to increase die type.
Core Skills
Start at d4.

Athletics [Agility]: d4 (+0)
Common knowledge [Smarts]: d4 (+0)
Notice [Smarts]: d4 (+0)
Persuasion [Spirit]: d4 (+0)
Stealth [Agility]: d4 (+0)

Other Skills
Start at d4-2 (Core, pg. 89).

Some skill [Agility]: d4 (+1)

Derived Stats

Pace: 6 (default); may be affected by other aspects
Parry: 2 + 1/2 Fighting die type
Toughness: 2 + 1/2 Vigor die type + Armor

Edges

Crystalmancy ([insert gem type here]) (Novice, free from Initial Edge)

Gear
We will not be purchasing gear. Work with the DM to create your character’s starting gear based on your background and your Crystalmancy edge.
Powers
Your powers should be based on your Gear. Remember you can create powers based on Enhancement, Projection, and Intrinsic Power.

Crystalmancy ([insert gem type here]): 15 power points, 2 starting powers

Power 1: Trappings description
Power 2: Trappings description

_gempaign/Intro.title: Intro
_gempaign/Intro.content:
Intro
This section of notes is specifically related to a TTRPG campaign run within the Crystalborne setting. It contains notes both on a story within the setting and notes specific to the TTRPG mechanics (i.e., Savage Worlds).
Hook

As rumors of the exchange of an Origin Gem circulate, you find yourself with a letter of recruitment in your pocket signed by the infamous Orchestrator “B”, Who are you, and why were you, of all people, chosen to ensure it doesn’t reach its new proprietor?


Gems have always been a normal aspect of life. They’re present in your commute illuminating info boards and creating hardlight subway cars; the tools you use for your job; and the care you receive when you get injured. You’re hounded by Arbiters over the usage of your gems as they bark at you over the scarcity of gems; meanwhile, you watch as entire building blocks are demolished and built back up again with the power of gems simply because someone higher up ordered it so.
Rumors of an Origin Gem being exchanged between the Trinity Kingdom and the Deepcrystal Enclave have reached your ears as you go about your life. You’ve seen in the news how the two nations are constantly at each other’s throats. Although this exchange could start to soothe things over between them—at least temporarily—you know it could be decades before the benefits even begin to reach you if at all.
Street life buzzes with activity as individuals and criminal organizations rush to complete their preparations. You ponder the letter you yourself have received.

Find me if you’d like a real shot at the gem without crystallizing yourself to death. — Jane

Answering Jane’s call means the chance of breaking free from your station in life, guaranteeing yourself a future among supercharged individuals and nations that threaten to trample over you, and having a tangible shot at your dreams whether you desire a nation of your own or a quiet life away from it all.
Getting Started

Read the setting summary and anything else that interests you.
Create a character concept. Here are some questions to help get you started:

What gem-type (or types) is your character compatible with?
What nation is your character aligned with if any? Are they a native or a transplant? If the latter, why did they move?
Are there any powers/gems you’d like that I haven’t yet introduced? Come talk to me.
What about gems interest you or do you resent gems entirely?
Are you an academic, combatant, or something more normal? Why do you work in that role?


Schedule a session 0 with the GM (i.e., me). During this, we will cover the following:

the setting,
character creation,
what gameplay will look like,
any setting-specific rules I will have in effect, and
anything else you have questions on.


(Optional) Review the gameplay rules and get acquainted with the virtual tabletop before session 1.

_gempaign/Setting-Mechanics.title: Setting Mechanics
_gempaign/Setting-Mechanics.content:
Setting Mechanics
Rolls (Core pg. 87)

Aces (exploding dice) apply to any Trait, damage roll, and wild die.
Raises apply on any Trait roll.
Wild die is rolled whenever making a Trait roll.

Initial Edge
All characters will get one Crystalmancy Edges  for free.
Setting Rules

For Crystalmancy.Never SurrenderSuper, pg. 35A Joker allows Incapacitated Wilds Cards to recover.Villainous ConvictionFantasy, pg. 79Conviction for villains.Wealth1Core, pg. 145For abstracting wealth management.Wound CapCore, pg. 141A single attack can deal a maximum of 4 wounds.
You are free to draw upon the Fantasy companion book for creation (namely power modifiers).
Modifications
Crystalmancy Edges
To demonstrate differences between gem-types and a person’s compatibility, each gem will have its own unique Arcane Background Edge and complementary skill. These will all be reskins of Arcane Background (Weird Sciences) (Core, pg. 148).
Each one will give you 15 power points and 2 powers that must include Gem Tech of the same type in the Trapping.























































Arcane Background EdgeSkillAttributeCrystalmancy (Amethyst)InsightSpiritCrystalmancy (Bismuth)ManipulationStrengthCrystalmancy (Diamond)RedirectionStrengthCrystalmancy (Emerald)GrowthSmartsCrystalmancy (Fulgurite)ConductionSmartsCrystalmancy (Labradorite)ShowmanshipSpiritCrystalmancy (Ruby)ReflexesAgilityCrystalmancy (Sapphire)MultitaskingSmartsCrystalmancy (Quartz)GainSpirit
Gem Tech
Gem tech is the required component of Weird Sciences with the modification that they will not be locked to any single person. Arcane Devices, a separate concept, are all about the sharing of power points, so we will not be engaging with them.
While gems have an implied limit in the lore, it is much more likely the character succumbs to excessive Strain first. Keeping the power points with the character helps demonstrate this concept.
Footnotes

Known criminal that has taken part in smaller gem heists, though none nearly as important as an origin gem. Enjoys heists for the thrill. Also has a gun Papers report with the pseudonym “Silent Veil”

Soren

Born into a to-the-death fighting ring

_gempaign/_characters/Thalen.title: Thalen
_gempaign/_characters/Thalen.content:
Thalen
Hails from the Shardlands; discovered compatibility w/ the Emerald gem type via fragments found in the Shardlands and began using this newfound ability to heal the less fortunate commonly found there; ultimately become frustrated w/ the lack of knowledge & resources, moved to the Trinity Kingdom and enrolled in the Tricolor Academy in an effort to increase skill / ability; however, seen as an outsider and generally displeased w/ the Kingdom’s structure of government.

_gempaign/_sessions/2025-11-09-Session-1.title: 2025-11-09 Session 1 - Into the Deep End
_gempaign/_sessions/2025-11-09-Session-1.content:
Next >>
2025-11-09 Session 1 - Into the Deep End
Our characters Ben, Deacon, Neptune, Serra, Soren, and Thalen all meet at an inner city bar. Thalen and Deacon arrived first and the others arrived shortly after. An altercation nearly broke out between Soren and Neptune as the later attempted to pickpocket the aggressive combatant. Serra watched it unfold and only stepped in to prevent the party from tearing itself apart before it could even be formed.
Serra led the others into a room to introduce them to Jane who introduced everyone to the job. The party pressed her on why them; Jane responded with some threats and an explanation that tonight’s job is preparation for the big heist and the team meant to execute it bailed on her. The timeline is too tight for tonight’s preparation to be missed. She briefs the team that she needs them to patch her into the Prismatic Guard’s communication network.
The team departs for the job shortly have Jane withdraws. They sneak into the seemingly under-guarded facility and successfully install the software Jane needed them to but not without setting off an alarm. The party quickly vacates the premises undetected and arrive back at the bar. Once there, they encounter The Sentinel, incapacitate his entourage of Ruby Arbiters, and beat him senseless.

_history/Commonization.title: Commonization
_history/Commonization.content:
Commonization
Gems have always existed, but the few gems that were discovered were of too powerful a generation to be handled safely. Any attempts to do so always ended with Crystallization often encompassing a wide area. Many steered clear from gems while few coveted their power enough to continue on despite the danger. This greed and lust for power spurred the creation of weaker and weaker generation gems via crystallization; the pioneers’ attempts and experiments made steady progress but always at the loss of life.
As gems became slightly less lethal through the proliferation of we, these pioneers would engage in trades with powerful individuals and families where the pioneer would receive support and the latter would display the gem as a symbol of power. Given the near-guaranteed fatality rate of pioneers, their findings were largely tribal knowledge, and they flaunted stories and knowledge to gain social standing. This led to the formation of the initial gem families.
The allure of gems continue to draw in those wishing to come into power, and gems continued to gradually weaken through their recklessness and crystallization. The more people that were able to stake their claim in this rush for gems, the more the powerful families wished to consolidate and regulate the power often resulting in skirmishes between even one another. Some pioneers were tasked with creating weaponry to assist in these wars. Many of these attempts ended in failures and loss of weaponry, but they eventually landed on the use of Runes leading to the first ever Runeographers and Inscriptionists.
Initial iterations involved rune inscriptions etched directly on the gem, but this was quickly abandoned in favor of inscribing runes on equipment instead of on the gem as the latter severely limited the usefulness of the gem. This combination of runes and equipment exponentially lessened the burden on the user leading to mass adoption of gem weaponry and escalated minor conflicts into full-blown wars. Although powerful, those granted the privilege of wielding such weaponry relied on them too heavily and would fall to the effects of crystallization but not before wiping out swathes of enemies and scarring the lands.

_history/Gem-Family.title: Gem Family
_history/Gem-Family.content:
Gem Family
A family that owned a powerful early generation Gem which they utilized to gain power. Throughout the eras, they rose to power as society became more and more gem-focused.

_history/Gem-Scarcity.title: Gem Scarcity
_history/Gem-Scarcity.content:
Gem Scarcity
A worldwide problem of  modern times in which Gems have become too weak and too few. Nations scatter to address the issue as society has become too closely intertwined to lose the power of gems resulting in the creation of Shardwalkers.

_history/Industrialization.title: Industrialization
_history/Industrialization.content:
Industrialization
The wars from the times of Commonization began to die down as the consolidation of power worsened and the remaining participants could no longer sustain constant, escalating conflicts. With the pressures of war no longer bearing down on them, the novel Runeographers and Inscriptionists begin turning to other applications of Gems. These efforts resulted largely in enhanced versions of tools, with the biggest advancement being simple exoskeletons that helped reduce the strength required for laborious tasks (not enhancing the body). These tools greatly increased production speed and quality, but some of the workers using these tools and opportunists understanding the sheer value of gems and gem-enhanced equipment wanted more.
Gem-related crimes began to rise, and these unregulated gems infuriated the gem families who sponsored the creation and distribution of these tools. These families had either become governmental entities or gained a vice-like grip over existing governments following the Commonization wars, and they leveraged their influence to create Arbiters. These arbiters were tasked with regulating, protecting, monitoring, and even forcefully re-acquiring gems. Although this helped reduce gem-related crimes, it enforced the idea that gems were not owned by the public, and it enabled the families to pressure and constrict the Runeographers and Inscriptionists they sponsored.
The push for regulation caused the existing nations at the time to concentrate on single, focused locations effectively resulting in megacities and leaving much of the lands unclaimed. Although no one was forced to lived in these regulated societies, many chose to to continue benefitting from the advantages of gems. For those that chose to live elsewhere, they were spared the border checks by Arbiters ensuring unregulated gems aren’t coming in or going out.

_history/Modernization.title: Modernization
_history/Modernization.content:
Modernization
The discoveries of the Renaissance launched civilization into a new era littered with new creations based on hardlight. Construction evolved to integrate Gems that projected hardlight into parts of the structure to create doors, moving parts, etc. Constructs could be suspended midair for increased maneuverability. Transportation created entirely from hardlight allowed for the quick shuttling of groups of people. Civilian-oriented gadgetry & equipment was created and licensed albeit under the intense scrutiny of the Arbiters.
However, the rapid, unabated progress made for multiple eras was beginning to come to a close. Gems, although known to be growing weaker and weaker through the generations, had become too weak—a problem referred to as the Gem Scarcity. The pool of gems became diluted, and Origin Gems were now near impossible to find. The families, now the de facto—if not actual—government, were increasingly anxious as it doubts whether they could sustain the ever-growing dependency on gems grew. This spurred a new gem-focused occupation known as Shardwalkers tasked with finding powerful gems in the still largely uncolonized war torn lands.

_history/Operation-Hyena.title: Operation Hyena
_history/Operation-Hyena.content:
Operation Hyena
An operation carried out by the Arbiters of the Prismatic Guard guard to crush the smuggling groups of the Glowhollow in an effort to reduce illegal activity. Although many groups were targeted, the Jackals were their main concern; the Hellions were deployed to specifically target them
.
The operation was a great success and crippled, if not entirely eliminated, all prominent smuggling groups. It is taught about in schools and used as training material in the Tricolor Academy.
However, the crippling of smuggling groups has diminished the quality of life in the Glowhollow but that part is conveniently left out in the historical accounts.

_history/Renaissance.title: Renaissance
_history/Renaissance.content:
Renaissance
Runeographers largely avoided applying Gem energy to organic matter due to the threat of Crystallization, but the gem families seeking to expand their influence would pressure their sponsored runeographers & Inscriptionists into beginning experiments leveraging the control they gained during Industrialization. Experimental prototypes of armor and clothing were developed to channel gem energy into the human body, and two major discoveries were made through them:

different types of gems respond differently
organic matter is far more susceptible to crystallization

Seeing that different types of gems would respond differently, research began to profile the exact power behind each gem type. Given that this was performed on organic matter—most often people—research was done under the table with the sponsoring family often taking advantage of a person’s ignorance. With enough time and sacrificial lambs, the Intrinsic Powers were discovered, documented, and published.
Resilience Profiling
Further research eventually lead to the discovery of Resilience, and it was swiftly discovered that this metric was different for each type of material and gem type, and that organic matter has far lower resilience.
The published powers caused the masses to develop interest in discovering what gem types they had high resilience in and were therefore compatible with. Testing centers were established in response. Testing was not done freely, and the revenue generated from this only served to cement the wealth and power of the original sponsoring families & authorities.
Discovery of Projection
Another avenue those sponsored were forced to pursue was the discovery of other applications of gems. The discovery of Projection was monumental. The applications of hardlight were near limitless especially in industrious applications such as construction, and even had applications in combat as Arbiters were eager to demonstrate.

_organizations/Ascendants.title: Ascendants
_organizations/Ascendants.content:
Ascendants
The faction of the Aetheric Conclave hoping to radicalize the nation into a technological Gem-focused revolution to catch-up to the Deepcrystal Enclave and Trinity Kingdom in advancement.

_organizations/Exaltists.title: Exaltists
_organizations/Exaltists.content:
Exaltists
The faction of the Aetheric Conclave that believes in the sanctity of Gems. They are the ruling faction of the nation.

_organizations/Hellions.title: Hellions
_organizations/Hellions.content:
Hellions
A singular, elite squad of the Prismatic Guard. They pride themselves on their combat ability and grit. They are deployed by the Trinity Kingdom in high risk scenarios such as Operation Hyena.
Notable Members

Artemis (current leader)
Orion
Jekyll & Hyde
Kai (former)

_organizations/Jackals.title: Jackals
_organizations/Jackals.content:
Jackals
A band of Glowhollow smugglers once widely respected for having served as the backbone of the supply chain many relied on to survive. The organization was gutted during the events of Operation Hyena and is now but a husk of its former self.
Notable Members

Heimdall (current leader)
The Doctor
Octave
Silver

_organizations/Prismatic-Guard.title: Prismatic Guard
_organizations/Prismatic-Guard.content:
Prismatic Guard
A joint coalition of Arbiters and Shardwalkers developed and deployed by the Trinity Kingdom.
They operate in units of Emerald, Sapphire, and Ruby functioning as healer, operator/logistician, and combatant respectively.

_organizations/Tinkerer's-Guild.title: Tinkerer's Guild
_organizations/Tinkerer's-Guild.content:
Tinkerer’s Guild
A guild regulating the distribution and management of Gems within the Deepcrystal Enclave for the purpose of experimentation and development by Inscriptionists and Runeographer. They are widely respected by its member and nation denizens.

_people/Arbiter.title: Arbiter
_people/Arbiter.content:
Arbiter
An occupation concerned with the regulation, protection, and monitoring of Gems. They function as a specialized police force for all gem-related matters.

_people/Heimdall.title: Heimdall
_people/Heimdall.content:
Heimdall
Originally born into the high society of the Trinity Kingdom, he ran away from home during his late teenage years which eventually lead to him becoming the leader of the Jackals.
Appearance
[TODO: AGGG]
Equipment
He sports a rapier of Labradorite capable of blinding his foes through flashes of light and firing rays of condensed light. He is almost never seen without wearing the previous Jackals leader’s coat.
History
He grew up in one of the more powerful families of the Trinity Kingdom and was to be next in line as the family head. The pressure slowly gnawed at him and eventually boiled over when his Resilience was tested; it was revealed he was incompatible with any of the three gems beloved by the Kingdom.
He ran away while still a teenager and stumbled his way through the Glowhollow getting by with what funds he took with him. He caught a pickpocket red-handed which led to an altercation causing the then leader of the Jackals to get involved. Heimdall was adopted into the group and never looked back.
Presently, he serves as the Jackals’s current leader trying to raise it back to its former glory.
Temperament
Although he is past his troubled youth, Heimdall is the epitome of taking calculated risks. Not everything works out for him, but he takes it in stride.
He has a soft spot for those trapped by their circumstances as it reminds him of his younger self. This feeling is best demonstrated by his looking after Silver.
Trivia

Based on Hugo from ZZZ

_people/Inscriptionist.title: Inscriptionist
_people/Inscriptionist.content:
Inscriptionist
An occupation concerned with the inscription of Runes onto gems or equipment. People who work as one will collaborate closely with Runeographers or be one themself.

_people/Jane.title: Jane
_people/Jane.content:
Jane
Infamous Orchestrator of the Glowhollow. Nothing is known about her and no one has ever seen her.

_people/Kai.title: Kai
_people/Kai.content:
Kai
A captain of the Prismatic Guard with poor Resilience in all Gem types but makes up for it through extreme dexterity and acumen.
He is known as “The Sentinel” for his hyper-observance.
Appearance
[TODO]
Equipment
He wears Diamond-based armor on his joints to manipulate his limbs like whips. He dances between Crystallization and snapping his limbs from his body as he channels his gems in quick bursts for explosive speed and power.
History
He grew up in the Trinity Kingdom and was able to attend the Tricolor Academy only after his guardians pulled some strings. Although he showed great potential in combat, his peers mocked him for his low Resilience. Against the better recommendations of his instructors, he relentlessly pursued the Ruby pathway to pursue his desire for combat.
He persevered and eventually joined the Hellions in time to participate in Operation Hyena. He played a major role in crippling the Jackals and his accolades there led to him becoming a Prismatic Guard captain.
Temperament
Once driven and emotionally volatile, he is presently a tired, jaded person only continuing to carry out his obligations out of routine and unfamiliarity with any other life.
Trivia

Based on Lycaon from ZZZ

_people/Octave.title: Octave
_people/Octave.content:
Octave
The Jackals’s resident info-broker and front-liner, Octave is the judge, jury, and executioner of the group. His actions are reigned in only by Heimdall.
When he isn’t on a job, he’s writing new songs or performing at whatever underground venue is willing to host him.
Appearance
[TODO]
Equipment
He sports boots, gloves, neck jewelry, and earrings all of Quartz make. He compresses sound to create bursts of speed through his boots, vibrate objects to the point they shatter through his gloves, and project medium-range shock waves through his neckware. His earrings enhance his hearing and serve as his method of gathering information.
History
Since childhood, Octave has been fascinated with music and learned as much as he could about it in hopes of becoming a star. He unfortunately never made it into the mainstream and achieved niche underground popularity at best.
To support his ambition, he—like Silver—took on odd jobs but his disposition landed him in hot water with the Prismatic Guard after brawling with hecklers at one of his performances. Heimdall bailed him out and gave him a job with the Jackals.
Temperament
Unlike the calculating Silver, analytical Doctor, and intuitive Heimdall, Octave gives in fully to his impulses. He often lands himself in trouble but is able to make up for it with sheer combat prowess. This pattern has led to him becoming a battle junkie.
Trivia

Based on Jabber from Gachiakuta

_people/Orchestrator.title: Orchestrator
_people/Orchestrator.content:
Orchestrator
Someone who makes things happen in the underworld. They accept requests from clients and contact those they think are a best fit for the job. They provide a level of anonymity for clients and steady work to those willing to work these risky johs.

_people/Runeographer.title: Runeographer
_people/Runeographer.content:
Runeographer
An occupation concerned with the scientific study of Runes and how to combine them to better and more safely harness Gem power.

_people/Shardwalker.title: Shardwalker
_people/Shardwalker.content:
Shardwalker
An occupation focused on the discovery and extraction of Gems to replenish stockpiles and reserves. The more potent of a gem—and thus more early of a generation—they find, the greater the accolades and respect they receive.
The exact details of how they operate depends on the nation (e.g., Prismatic Guard), but they are near-unanimously revered and feared by the general public.

_people/Silver.title: Silver
_people/Silver.content:
Silver
A scout and sniper of the Glowhollow who works both as an unofficial Shardwalker for hire and with the Jackals as a smuggler. The latter only because Heimdall incessantly pestered her to join for the occasional mission.
Appearance
[TODO: silver hair]
Equipment
She wields a sniper rifle capable of shooting both Diamond-powder bullets and normal gunpowder bullets. The former type has earned her the moniker of Whispering Death due to their relatively silent nature.
The rifle works through a combination of Diamond powder in the bullet casing and the Diamond inlay in the rifle connecting the trigger to the hammer to the bullet. These bullets are difficult to source on her own, but she receives help from The Doctor. She collects the ejected casings to reduce the amount of ones she has to inscribe Runes into. Thankfully, she needs only a little bit of powder to match the power of gunpowder and she can swap in normal bullets if need be.
As a last resort, she is able to create primitive projectiles via a Bismuth gadget and can launch them with only the force of Diamond available through the rifle’s inlay.
History
Silver lived as normal a life one could in the Glowhollow, but the fallout of Operation Hyena brought her way of life and her family to ruin. She took on odd jobs to help her family get by and eventually they took her into the Shardlands. She scrounged her signature rifle from some corpses while out on a job and learned how to work with Gems by restoring it to working order.
As her jobs became more involved, she needed a guaranteed way to get past the Prismatic Guard when entering and exiting the Trinity Kingdom. She worked with various smugglers but most often with the Jackals given that both parties didn’t inspire confidence in anyone else. Heimdall would not so subtly hint that she should join them for some added stability to which she reluctantly agreed to after some time.
Temperament
Cautious out of fear but a risk-taker out of necessity, she is willing to do whatever it takes to take care of her family. This often leads to clashes between her and Heimdall who largely goes off of feeling.
Trivia

Based on Silver Squad, Anby, Trigger from ZZZ
Based on Lady Nagant from MHA

_people/Stoneshire.title: Stoneshire
_people/Stoneshire.content:
Stoneshire
A Gem Family powerful enough to found the Trinity Kingdom. They continue to hold seats of power in modern times.

_people/The-Doctor.title: The Doctor
_people/The-Doctor.content:
The Doctor
Little is known about The Doctor outside of the Jackals. Like Heimdall, they are a veteran from the time before Operation Hyena and continue their work of supporting the group as an Inscriptionist and medic would despite only having a few members worth of gear to help with. They do, however, have much more time to work on their personal experiments now.
Appearance
[TODO: that one weird butler from black butler]
Equipment
They wear a worn down lab coat and a claw of Emerald on one hand and one of Bismuth on another. These enable them to work as an Inscriptionist, mechanic, doctor, etc. for the group.
History
The Doctor began as a curious tinkerer but their curiosity led them to join the pre-Operation Hyena Jackals to secure more Gems to experiment on. Overtime, they grew close to the members and Heimdall only to have it all ripped away.
They continue working with Heimdall out of a sense of obligation to restore the Jackals to their former glory.
Temperament
Curious to a fault and hardened by the events of Operation Hyena, they work to unravel every last mystery of the Gems but prioritize the health and equipment of their fellow members.
Given the effects of Operation Hyena, they avoid showing explicit signs of their care in hopes they don’t get too attached to any of the current members. When it’s just them and Heimdall, they tend to open up a little bit to reminisce on old times.
Trivia

Based on ??? from ???

_places/Aetheric-Conclave.title: Aetheric Conclave
_places/Aetheric-Conclave.content:
Aetheric Conclave
A location once seen as a religious epicenter since Commonization but gained popularity and power during the Renaissance. It discriminates against no one but is ruled and regulated by Amethyst users. Unlike other contemporary nations, the Aetheric Hold is focused on spiritual enlightenment and peaceful co-existence with Gems rather than weaponizing or inventing with them.
It is vastly behind its contemporaries in Modernization and is widely regarded as an obscure, dying nation. Its native denizens are divided between the Exaltists who adhere to tradition and worship or the Ascendants modernizing with the rest of the world.
Appearance Notes (TODO)

Surrounded by mountains
Exists inside the valleys and on the sides of the mountains

_places/Deepcrystal-Enclave.title: Deepcrystal Enclave
_places/Deepcrystal-Enclave.content:
Deepcrystal Enclave
The Enclave began as a collection of disjointed settlements in close proximity to the Scar. They came together during Industrialization but took great care to preserve the spirit of tinkering and independent experimentation that was born from having an abundance of accessible Gems. This approach led to the formation of the Tinkerer’s Guild, which continues to act as the de facto governing body of the nation, and many independent Inscriptionists and Runeographers flock to it. Instead of acting as enforcers, Arbiters work to maintain the structure of the city and Shardwalkers work closely with the guild to meet demands.
Appearance
The nation is suspended by chains attached to the walls of the Scar. Districts have been assembled chaotically through Bismuth and Labradorite based construction instead of projected hardlight.

_places/Glowhollow.title: Glowhollow
_places/Glowhollow.content:
Glowhollow
The undercity of the Trinity Kingdom. It is the one place where there isn’t constant Arbiter presence, and it is instead ruled by smuggler groups like the Jackals.

_places/Scar.title: Scar
_places/Scar.content:
Scar
The Scar is a large ravine found in the Shardlands. It houses many Origin Gems and is therefore extremely dangerous; Crystallization by unharvested gems is the leading cause of death here.
The Scar has been present since Commonization and historians debate its origins. Before the Deepcrystal Enclave established itself here, this area was a constant warzone as everyone fought over its resources.

_places/Shardlands.title: Shardlands
_places/Shardlands.content:
Shardlands
The lands dotted with scars from the Commonization wars and left unclaimed as civilization concentrated from Industrialization. It is considered heavily dangerous due to the untamed wilds and the presence of early generation gems threatening to crystallize all that come near. Shardwalkers are deployed here to find and excavate gems but often engage in conflicts with seekers of other allegiances.
Aside from the danger and lack of advancement, there isn’t anything preventing people from living in these lands. Those that do do so to avoid the ever-increasing regulations and the rough enforcement of the Arbiters.

_places/Tricolor-Academy.title: Tricolor Academy
_places/Tricolor-Academy.content:
Tricolor Academy
A prestigious academic institution in the Trinity Kingdom purpose-built to create more Arbiters, Shardwalkers, Inscriptionists, and Runeographers. Those who refute or fail in those pathways still have the opportunity to populate other necessary occupations in society.

_places/Trinity-Kingdom.title: Trinity Kingdom
_places/Trinity-Kingdom.content:
Trinity Kingdom
The kingdom was originally established during Commonization with the help of many prominent gem families. The founding family, the Stoneshires, had a preference for Emeralds, rubies, and Sapphires which continues to influence the social landscape of the nation even in modern times.
The nation has developed rapidly with the power Gems, but its origins have led to strict documentation, control, and regulation of gems. Arbiters monitor shops, streets, interiors, etc. for unauthorized use; customs have been set up at ingress/egress points to check for any unregistered gems.
Appearance
In modern times, the nation has developed into one giant mega-city and has been politically broken down into wards to make management easier. Businesses are packed so closely together that whatever you could need is always within a few blocks, traversing the city is enabled by hardlight-powered transportation, and crowds populate every inch of the city streets. The more affluent wards have buildings constructed almost entirely out of hardlight, but even the more dilapidated wards can undergo rapid renovation through gem-assisted construction.
The nation is surrounded by vast plains on all sides.
The Trinity
Given the founding family’s preference in gems, people lacking high Resilience in those gem types tend to lack any real social mobility. Meanwhile, the nation has constructed the Tricolor Academy purpose-built for training more recruits for the Prismatic Guard.

_theory/Amethyst.title: Amethyst
_theory/Amethyst.content:
Amethyst
Power
An amethyst’s Intrinsic Power grants its users foresight. The more power the user draws out, the further they can see into the future ranging from a few seconds to upwards of a year.
Role
They have no specific role nor equipment.
Risk
Crystallization crystallizes the users sensory organs until they are left with nothing but their thoughts and a failing body.

_theory/Bismuth.title: Bismuth
_theory/Bismuth.content:
Bismuth
Power
Bismuth is prized for its Intrinsic Power of morphing physical matter and is responsible for much of the non-hardlight constructions in the Modern era.
Role
Users commonly work in construction and wield bismuth through hand tools.
Risk
Crystallization will cause the user’s body to meld and fuse into the material they were constructing.

_theory/Crystallization.title: Crystallization
_theory/Crystallization.content:
Crystallization
The phenomena of matter being converted into Gems when the incurred Strain exceeds Resilience. The converted matter loses its previous properties and function and is quite severe on its own, but the abuse of Intrinsic Powers can lead to even more dire consequences.
The resulting gems are of a subsequent Gem Generation.

_theory/Diamond.title: Diamond
_theory/Diamond.content:
Diamond
Power
The Intrinsic Power of Diamond allows for manipulating the forces applied to an object.
Role
Users were widely employed in utility tasks by ferrying goods around during Industrialization and were most commonly found in construction work. However, in modern times, the required level of physics understanding led to it being widely replaced by manual labor through Ruby and the more intuitive Bismuth.
Risk
Crystallization results in gems that repel one another; excessive amounts can lead to the user being ripped apart.

_theory/Emerald.title: Emerald
_theory/Emerald.content:
Emerald
Power
Emerald has the Intrinsic Power of manipulating organic matter. Although useful for more other tasks, they’re mainly used for healing. Despite the miraculous healing potential, users require an extensive medical background to coax wounds to heal properly as the gem has no knowledge of how to properly heal a wound—improper utilization of emeralds can lead to grotesque growths on the body.
Role
Users often work in service, hospitality, and medicine; and their equipment usually appears in gloves or rings to lend itself toward precise handwork. Users who prefer a less tense life may work with plants and animals instead.
Risk
Although capable of mending wounds at an accelerated pace, it seemingly draws from the life force of the wielder and places even those with high Resilience at risk of Crystallization. To protect themselves, users often heal the bare minimum for their patient to survive.

_theory/Enhancement.title: Enhancement
_theory/Enhancement.content:
Enhancement
A method of utilizing the raw energy from a Gem to strengthen, empower, or energize some form of matter.

_theory/Fulgurite.title: Fulgurite
_theory/Fulgurite.content:
Fulgurite
Power
A way to manipulating electricity but not produce it and is thus heavily used to monitor and regulate power through civilization.
Role
Utility.
Risk
Crystallization takes place in the crystals conductive enough to drain the power from any nearby source in bursts resulting in electrical burns.

_theory/Gem-Equipment.title: Gem Equipment
_theory/Gem-Equipment.content:
Gem Equipment
Equipment, or similar, made to hold a Gem and influence it via Runes usually inscribed onto the equipment.
It existed solely in the form of weaponry during Commonization, grew into the category of tools during Industrialization, and then integrated into the lives of civilians under heavy regulation during Modernization.
The equipment manufactured for & licensed to civilians would have runes directly inscribed onto the gem to limit their use outside of regulation. These devices targeted quality-of-live improvements and most commonly appeared in the form of household appliances or accessories cabale of projecting pre-programmed utility constructs.

_theory/Gem-Generation.title: Gem Generation
_theory/Gem-Generation.content:
Gem Generation
The Gems created through Crystallization are denoted as a subsequent generation. These gems are weaker than the previous generation.

_theory/Gem.title: Gem
_theory/Gem.content:
Gem
A concentrated collection of energy capable of enhancing or empowering both organic and inorganic matter. They contain raw energy utilized through Enhancement,Projection, and a type-dependent Intrinsic Power. Gems must be activated through an impetus; most commonly this is through user intent.

_theory/Intrinsic-Power.title: Intrinsic Power
_theory/Intrinsic-Power.content:
Intrinsic Power
In addition to a Gem’s raw energy, each gem of a specific type can harness a specific power. They impart great Strain and will have unique Crystallization effects depending on the gem-type.

_theory/Labradorite.title: Labradorite
_theory/Labradorite.content:
Labradorite
Power
Labradorite allows for the manipulation of light as its Intrinsic Power making it incredibly versatile with applications ranging from simple lighting fixtures, to “digital” displays, to twisting light into optical illusions.
Role
The gem itself is often found powering lights in modern buildings and users often work in the entertainment industry.
Risk
Crystallization results in Gems that concentrate light onto the conjoined surface—users suffering from Labradorite crystallization thus avoid the sun like a plague.

_theory/Origin-Gem.title: Origin Gem
_theory/Origin-Gem.content:
Origin Gem
An early generation Gem, These are highly sought after and scarce in the Modern era known for their immense power. In the wild, they can spontaneously crystallize entire swathes of land. When harnessed properly, they’re capable of single-handedly powering a civilization.

_theory/Projection.title: Projection
_theory/Projection.content:
Projection
The physical manifestation of a Gem’s raw energy in the form of hardlight. The appearance and behavior of the hardlight depends on Runes.

_theory/Quartz.title: Quartz
_theory/Quartz.content:
Quartz
Power
Heavily valued in the audio industry, Quartz is used in someway for the capture and playback of audio. It makes its way into consumer devices and any audio production setup is sure to be packed full of it. Some entertainers even manage to construct sounds using nothing but Quartz.
Role
Mostly used in consumer audio devices or in audio production. Tends to be paired with Labradorite.
Risk
Crystallization takes place in the form of sound absorbing crystals until the user is suffocated by blaring silence.

_theory/Resilience.title: Resilience
_theory/Resilience.content:
Resilience
A measure of matter’s intrinsic resistance to Strain. Dependent on gem-type. Inorganic matter generally has a higher resilience.

_theory/Ruby.title: Ruby
_theory/Ruby.content:
Ruby
Power
The Intrinsic Power of rubies grants enhanced reflexes allowing its users to move far before they register a threat. The senses one naturally takes in through their body are made so vivid that the user can visualize the surrounding environment without even looking at it.
Role
Users work in labor-intensive roles but are most commonly found in combative roles and comprise the vast majority of Arbiter and Shardwalker combatants. Their equipment comes in the forms of joint-armor, gloves/gauntlets, or outright weaponry.
Risk
Crystallization primarily targets their sensory organs and nerves.

_theory/Runes.title: Runes
_theory/Runes.content:
Runes
Inscription writing used to direct, manipulate, and regulate the released power of Gems; and they appear most commonly on equipment to safely deliver power to the body or on machines to convert that power into energy while minimizing Strain.

_theory/Sapphire.title: Sapphire
_theory/Sapphire.content:
Sapphire
Power
Sapphire’s Intrinsic Power grants its users accelerated thought but does not increase their intelligence. They could conclude the best possible scenario despite hundreds of variables or simply arrive at a bad decision quicker (i.e., “I’m stupid faster”).
Role
They often work as Runeographers, as Inscriptionists, in logistics, or in other office or artisan related work. Their equipment comes in the form of everyday accessories such as watches, bracelets, or rings.
Risk
The stakes of Crystallization are much higher since the power affects the user’s brain, and the best case for overuse is severe impairment of brain function.

_theory/Strain.title: Strain
_theory/Strain.content:
Strain
The stress imparted on matter when Gem energy is being channeled. The basic applications of gem power—Enhancement and Projection—incurs very little strain compared to Intrinsic Power.

index.title: Crystalborne
index.content:
Crystalborne
A collection of notes exploring an original setting and documenting a campaign run within the setting.
How to Explore
Folders are simply used to declutter the space. Prefer navigating by tags by prefixing your search with # or by going to tags.
The main entry points to these notes are:

Gem or theory to begin exploring the theory
Commonization or era to begin exploring the history

Summary
The easiest way to imagine this setting is as Cyberpunk in a fantasy world.
This setting is centered around Gems and the powers they grant. Entire civilizations have formed around them with the two most prominent being the Trinity Kingdom and the Deepcrystal Enclave. The world has reached Modernization and blends technology and magic through gems. Gems are prevalent in all facets of life from daily errands, transportation, construction, medical care, combat, etc.
The great benefits of gems are balanced out by the risks of Crystallization which has historically led to many deaths and scars across the lands. Gems have also become increasingly weak and scarce over the eras which is the root of most conflict in the world.
Those seeking adventure usually become a Shardwalker exploring the Shardlands, but others choose to just enjoy the benefits that gems give them. Those that detest gems typically join or form an independent settlement outside of the mega-civilizations.
